content.description: Best mantle in Little? One of my favorites anyway. Start on edges, campus to the lip, and then make your way over the top of it.
content.location: On the Whiskey boulder, about 25 ft right of Whiskey.

content.description: Start on edges close to the lip and mantle (trending left).
content.location: On the east side of the Whiskey boulder

content.description: Seldom climbed problem from the Black Bible. Start on left hand under cling side pull ~5 feet up. Only tricky part is getting on, then it was easy.
content.location: East side of the Alone Boulder, about 100 yds east of Dale’s Arete and Duct Tape. You’ll pass the big Whiskey Boulder cave about half way there. The Alone boulder can be easily seen and accessed from the bike trail too.

content.description:
What a super fun low ball!

Sit start with two large underclings. Slap, grunt, squeeze, wiggle, and hump your way to the top using sidepulls and slopers.

For a V5 variation, start the same but traverse left at the lip and top out near the adjacent boulder.
content.location: Walk past Dale's Arete to the Duct Tape boulder. This problem is on the backside, opposite from Duct Tape. (See photo.)

content.description: Start on right flake and climb up avoiding the left flake. Pull over the lip avoiding any holds on "Kate Moss" for full credit
content.location: Uphill of the Duct Tape Boulder

content.description:
Start as far right as possible on the Kate Moss boulder and traverse left avoiding any hand holds below the lip. Top out on "Kate Moss".

Pretty sure this has been done before, but if not credit goes to Jay Patel.
Start on the left flake and climb up. Right flake off.
content.location: Uphill of the duct tape boulder.

content.description:
Hard Liquor V7/8:

Another sweet mantle just a foot left of Whiskey. Start on the obvious sloper, move up right to a sloper knob, then rockover a high left foot. Funky.

Harder Liquor V10:

Eliminate the sloper knob above the lip, and flip straight to a burly mantle straight on the sloping shelf. Desperate. Once I had the press locked out, I bumped my right hand up to a little crimp in order to get my foot up.
Start on sloper, reach thin crimp on the left and mantle/lunge for lip (jump starting to the crimp is v7)
content.location: NW corner of the Duct Tape boulder

content.description:
Another disgustingly awesome mantle problem on nice quality rock.

Sit start on the obvious edge on the right side of the face. Pull up to bad slopers and a left sidepull, then press over the bulge.

Harder than Whiskey, though not nearly as classy. In fact it’s fairly gross, but maybe that will intrigue you!
content.location: From Whiskey, head east towards a short and long boulder with a crack running through it, which has 8 or so problems on it. This problem is a sit start on the right side of the short overhang.

content.description: Start on sloped edge and dyno to the lip. Avoid the dab
content.location: Backside of Dale's boulder just left of Charlie's Arete

content.description: Start with bad edges at shoulder height reach bad RH sloper and go for the top
content.location: West side of Duct Tape boulder

content.description: Starts on right hand side of the NW arete on Charlie's boulder then trends right at the lip.
Start on the lower right end of the NE arete and work your way up left to jugs and top out. Better hands with stronger moves than Dale’s Arete on the other side of the bolder.
content.protection: Couple pads, a fall at the end could be awkward on the smaller boulder below.
content.location: Arete on east side of the boulder with Dale’s Arete

content.description: Climb the other arete on Dale's Boulder
